review_blob: Pours amber, with medium head. Aroma of tropical fruits, some citrus notes. Nice bitterness with sweet backbone. Good IIPA. Not the best in Poland, but good one.

Good example of double IPA, almost a benchmark for the style - bu that also means that it isnt any unusual and creative in any way. Good bitterness countered with high sweetness, aroma of citrus, herbal, full body, nice head. Good beer
My first ever oude gueuze. Pours golden, with small, short head. Clear, high carbonated. Aroma of vinegar, sour, funky notes. Really sour taste, bit tart. Unusual beer, not bad.
Amber, with medium, white head. Aroma of hops, citrus notes. Medium bitterness, medium carbonation, medium body. Nice beer to drink, could be a bit more bitter.

One of the best witbiers Ive ever had. Aroma of oranges, coriander, bit sour notes, refreshing. Pours fuzzy, golden/yellow with nice, long head. High carbonation, medium body, low bitterness and medium sourness. Refreshing, easy to drink, really good.
Pours dark brown, with medium head. Aroma of bananas, yeast, some dark notes from malts. Full body, medium carbonation, medium bitterness (for the style). Great example of the style, good beer.

Like every other beer from the series, it is a great example of the style. Full body, great smoked aroma, dark brown with medium head. Easy to drink (if you like the style). Some nice yeasty notes along with the smoke. Really enjoyed it.

Perfect example of the style - not too extreme, not too light. Pours black, oily, with medium, brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, some dark fruits in the back. Medium bitterness, full body, low carbonated, with some nice alcohol notes. The aftertaste stays in your mouth long after finishing it. Good RIS, almost a benchmark for the style.
beer_name: BrewDog Old World Russian Imperial Stout (9.5%)

review_blob: It has everything that I liked about the basic Smoky Joe, but more and better. More peat, more smoke, more aroma, more taste. Great stout, great beer - but not for everyone, that I can say. If you dont like peated notes you wont like it. Otherwise youll just love it.

Oh this one was really a nice beer. Aroma of bananas, yeast, belgian notes but with a strong, hoppy, citrus note to it. Pours amber with medium head, fuzzy, medium carbonated, quite full. Nice, long bitterness with some weizen sweetness. Really drinkable, really good.

Not the best APA Ive ever had, but, for its price and availability it is one of the best things you can buy in your grocery store. Aroma is something between citrus and herbal, quite refreshing. Medium bitterness, high drinkability, not that bad at all.
Pours brown, with very short, white head. Highly carbonated, with medium body. Aroma of yeast, malts, some skin/horse notes, sweet. Taste is 50/50 sweet/sour. Fun to drink, not bad at all
Pours dark orange, with medium head. Good session beer, with some hoppy notes and a nice malty backbone. Taste is bit citrus but mostly herbal, resin. Medium body and carbonation, Not bad at all
Pours orange/gold with medium head. Aroma of grapefruit, hops, some herbal notes. Moderately bitter, with some malty background. Easy to drink, tasty, nice APA
Pours orange, hazy, with nice, medium head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, some hops. Moderately bitter with some sourness, extremely drinkable, really tasty. Medium body and carbonation. Really good beer
Great session beer, really refreshing and easy to drink. Aroma of grass, bit floral and malty. Moderately hoppy, with medium head and body. Quite similar to Miosaw Pilzner.
Really nice citrus aroma, lots of hops. Taste is mostly hoppy, citrus, fruity, refreshing. Pours orange, hazy, with medium head. Medium body & carbonation. Great APA, good session beer

Pours black, with nice, long, beige head. Aroma of hops, resin with some black notes. Medium body, medium carbonation. Quite hoppy with nice, bit sour roasted notes. Nice Black IPA, one of the best Polish ones. The orange is not really there thought.
Aroma of red wine, sour. Medium, short head. Tastes like wine, highly carbonated, light bodied. Dark red colour, hazy. Good beer

Pours dark gold, with medium, short head. Aroma of bread which i really liked, but besides bread there is not much more in there. Taste is a bit sour, malty, with small bitterness. Medium carbonation, medium body. Not that bad

Pours black, bit hazy with medium head. Roasty aroma, with some coffee and chocolate notes. Quite bitter, with lots of dark chocolate in taste. Medium body, nice to drink but better to sip than drink one after another.

Pours light yellow, hazy, with big, long head. Aroma of tropical fruits and coriander, very refreshing. High carbonation, light body, nice to drink. Medium bitterness, bit sour and floral, as refreshing as in the aroma. Nice beer, liked it.

Pours dark ruby, very hazy, with minimal head. Aroma of roasted banana with some chocolate notes, really pleasant. No carbonation, full body, extremely drinkable - I drank mine in, like, 10 minutes. Quite sweet in taste, bit bready with nice pine/juniper aftertaste. Really liked it.

Pours pitch black, oily, with brown, short head that stays in form of a ring around the glass to the end. Aroma of sweet dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Medium body and soft carbonation, the beer sticks to your mouth and stays there for a while. Taste is mostly coffee and roastiness, a bit sweet, with a long, bitter finish that stays in your mouth long after you finish your beer. Bitterness is a mix between roastiness and hops. Good beer, quite complex, gives you something to remember. Not that far away from some of the lighter imperial stouts.

Pours beautiful dark ruby, slightly hazy with nice creamy head that stays to the end. Aroma is malty, yeasty with hints of dark fruits, not very intensive. Medium body and carbonation. You can feel the liquor while drinking, but it is more like a warming sensation, not booze-like notes. Taste is malty with medium bitterness and quite delicate finish. Quite nice beer, but nothing that special.

Pours dark ruby, bit hazy, with small, short brown head. Aroma of dark fruits, cherries, liquor, bit whisky. It is oily and slick, with low carbonation. Taste is bourbon, bit sour at the beginning and medium bitter in the aftertaste. Good sipper, nice RIS, really complex beer.
beer_name: De Molen Rasputin Buffalo Trace BA

review_blob: Aroma of tropical and citrus fruits with resin. Quite sweet, but also really bitter. Pours with medium head, hazy, amber. Medium-bodied, low carbonated. Easy to drink. Nice AIPA

Light yellow, hazy, with medium white head. Aroma of grass, herbs, resin with a bit of citrus. Soft carbonation, medium body. Medium bitterness with small sweetness. Nice everyday beer, quite refreshing.

Pours light orange, with medium head. Aroma of malts with some tropical hoppiness. You can taste some of that hops, but it is mostly malty. Nice to drink when it is cold, warmer may show some alcoholic notes. As for a beer available in most shops, it is one of the best you can get, but apart from that it is only average.

Pours orange, very hazy, with nice, long head. Aroma of tropical fruits, some citrus notes in the back - typical to IPAs based on American hops. It is quite bitter, but also quite full-bodied. Easy to drink, bitterness is really nice, not staying in mouth. Good IPA.

Pours black, with medium head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, which is covering everything else. Taste is well balanced between sourness from roasted malts, coffee and chocolate notes. Low carbonation, easy to drink, really nice chocolate stout.

Pours golden to amber with medium but staying head. Minimal lacing, medium carbonation. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, pine with strong sweetness. Big bitterness (100 IBU!) balanced with big sweetness, Combine these two and you get a huge beer - 9% alc - which is really easy to drink. Alcohol is really well covered, you can feel it only by slight burning note on the throat while drinking. I enjoyed it really much. Good DIPA, one of the best in Poland, no shame in comparing it to worldwide-available DIPAs

Good beer, good stout. Aroma is mostly coffee with some sweet chocolate and a bit of roastiness. Beer is oily from the rye, light carbonated. with medium body. It is easy to drink, quite light when it comes to alcohol - almost 5%. The taste is mostly coffee as well, but you get some considerable amount of rye/roasted/coffee sourness and medium bitterness in the aftertaste.

I find this beer very similar to Miosaw Pilzner, which I like - but an IPA shouldnt really taste and smell like a pils beer this much. Some grass and malts in the aroma, medium carbonation, average-bodied. Orange/golden colour. Medium bitterness, could be higher, and the taste is mostly herbal, grassy. Beer is really drinkable, but Id like it to be a bit bigger - more hops, more body, more aroma.

Pours golden, bit hazy, not much like a witbier. Medium head. Aroma of coriander and some malty notes. Taste is bit sour, bit bitter, but it could have something more going on inside. Quite nice, drinkable beer, but nothing great.

Quite nice witbier. White-golden, hazy, with medium head. Medium carbonation, medium body. Aroma quite typical for a wit, but not very strong. Taste is much like the aroma - there is some bitterness, some sourness, bit orange, bit coranider, but it all is really delicate.
Pours black. Aroma of sweet chocolate with some coffee notes, really nice. Medium body, low carbonation, suprisingly bitter as for the sweet aroma. OK stout, pleasant to drink.

Small, short head, golden colour. Aroma of mirabelle, does not feel synthetic, and so does the taste - it really feels like a mirabelle. It is refresing - Id say 50/50 between sweet and sour in the taste. Good drinkability, nice fruit beer.

Aroma of plums with some dark notes. No hoppiness at all, the beer is sweet with some sourness. Good thing is that the taste doesnt feel synthetic - it really tastes like plums. When you drink this beer with good attitude - expecting something what you can drink in exchange for a juice when hanging out with friends, it really is not that bad.
Refreshing, mid-bodied, hoppy, very drinkable. Nice tropical aroma, really noticeable even when the beer is quite cold. Medium head, nice lacing. Good APA.

Pours pitch black with medium, but short brown head. It is sticky, oily, with low carbonation and full body. Aroma of chocolate liquor, roasted malts, plums and raisins with nice vanilla notes. Alcohol nicely heats your throat, and it is really well covered in taste. Beer is complex, you can taste some roasted malts, some chocolate, delicate sour notes from the barrel, bit coffee. It is quite liquorish, with medium to long finish. Bitterness could be a bit higher to conquer huge sweetness. Great sipper, great beer.
beer_name: To l Liquid Confidence (Aged in Cognac Barrels)

review_blob: Pours clear, deep red-brown, with small, short head. Very carbonated, medium to dry body. Aroma of vinegar, apples, cherries, wine; very refreshing. Taste is fruity and sour, really refreshing. Good beer, but i like my sour beers more intensive in taste and aroma.

Pours black with small, creamy and lasting head. Nice lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, bit coffee and a lot of sweet chocolate. Medium carbonation, medium to dry body. Medium bitterness, with long aftertaste. Tastes like a typical stout; roasted, chocolate and coffee, drinkable. Good beer.

Pours black, with minimal ruby reflexes on the sides. Medium, but long beige head. Aroma of chocolate and roastiness, with nice grassy hops in the background. Medium bitterness, low to medium carbonation, full body. Taste is nice and chocolate at the beginning, then it transforms to bitter and coffee finish with some spicy rye notes. Drinkable, tasty, really good beer.
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014

Bottle. Pours black, bit hazy, with small and short head, no lacing. Ruby reflexes on the sides. Medium body and low carbonation makes it easy to drink. Aroma of smoke with nice chocolate and some roastiness. Bit sour from roasted malts, with smoke and chocolate, and after that medium bitter and coffee finish. Good beer.
beer_name: Pracownia Piwa Cent US Smoked Stout

review_blob: Pretty decent beer. Pours dark brown, with medium, beige head. Aroma of dark malts, bit chocolate, not very intense, but nice. Dry body, medium carbonation, tastes sweet, with some cocoa and coffee, bit sour from roastiness. Quite refreshing as for a dark beer. Drinkable, nice and generally available in most local shops

Great beer to start your journey through smoked beers. Aroma is ham, smoke, campfire, but it is fairly light, with some sweet malty notes with it. It is similar with the taste, the smoked notes are quite light. Low carbonation and dry body makes it really drinkable

Good Baltic Porter. Pours black, with medium but short head. Aroma of chocolate mostly, with some coffee and roasted notes. It is a bit too sweet, could have more bitterness, but it is good as a first-try porter.

Pours dark gold, with medium head. Aroma is herbal, grassy hops and some fruits, caramel in the background. It is suprisingly bitter with a good malty backbone to it. Nice to drink and fairly easy to buy
